item.title: Ceres Road is filthy, 22nd January
item.description:
Despite multiple complaints to the council Ceres Road continues to get neglected and hasn’t been swept since before Christmas. We need a regular road clean as we pay for in our council tax.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ceres Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
A new lime green bike abandoned an the entrance of HFR

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Hither Farm Road, Kidbrooke, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filthy streets, 22nd January
item.description:
St Nicholas Rd and Ceres haven’t been swept in weeks. Filthy roads with loads of rubbish and fly tipping all over them. Have complained to the council but we still can’t get a regular road sweep as we pay for in our council tax.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Nicholas Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox on road, 22nd January
item.description:
There’s a dead fox in the middle or the road. Not sure how long it’s been there but I don’t think it’s been there a long time. It is near the traffic lights on Crown Lane Spur next to the ambulance station.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane Spur, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New road surface laid in December 2025 already breaking up, 22nd January
item.description:
New road surface laid in December 2025 already breaking up. Insufficient drainage and kerb protection resulting in traffic weight breaking up the newly laid road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Heathview Drive, London

item.title: Illegally parked Lime bike outside visually impaired resident's home, 22nd January
item.description:
FJL-PUA Lime bike illegally parked on footway outside visually impaired resident's house. Dumping on the footway like this appears to be malicious. Why doesn't Hackney Council or Lime take action in this area?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Sandringham Road, Shacklewell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing bus timetable on bus stop flag, 75 bus route Croydon-bound, fronting 54 Parish Lane, Penge SE20 7LJ, 22nd January
item.description:
Missing bus timetable on bus stop flag, 75 bus route Croydon-bound, fronting 54 Parish Lane, Penge SE20 7LJ The timetable for the other 194 route serving this stop is present. There is room for the missing 75 timetable on top of the generic low information value notice.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Maybe someone living here?, 21st January
item.description:
At this location there is a shopping trolley full of, stuff. There is some sort of wire or cable that is wrapped around a lot of the trees here as well? Maybe as some sort of alarm or warning in system if someone walks into the woods there.

item.title: Perimeter fence in disrepair, 21st January
item.description:
There are quite a few holes in your perimeter fence this does pose a bit of a risk as people do walk their dogs off lead in your park and having a perimeter fence which is not secure means some of those dogs might end up getting close to the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Hill Road, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
